Package com.david.java.classInitialization

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClassBlockInitializerLocalValue
    When working with class block initializers, keep in mind two more items: First, any variable that you declare in a class block initializer is local to that block.
    ClassBlockInitializers
    Although sufficient for class field initialization, class field initializers prove inadequate for more complex class initialization.
    ClassFieldInitializers
    Explicit initialization of class fields to values.
    ClassHierarchyInitializer
    When a class hierarchy is involved, the compiler creates a separate method for each class in that hierarchy.
    ClassInitialization
    A program consists of classes.
    DeclaredClassFieldInitializers
    Some programs require class fields to refer to previously declared class fields.
    ImproperObjectInitialization
    a superclass object field/block initializer can access a field in a subclass.
    ImproperObjectInizializationClassHierarchies
    there exists a situation in which you can declare a class hierarchy -- in which each class has its own initializers -- and, when you construct an object, no initializer executes.
    ObjectBlockComplexInitializer
    Object field initializers are sufficient for the initialization of object fields.
    ObjectBlockInitializers
    As with class fields, some programs require object fields to refer to previously declared object fields.
    ObjectFieldInitializers
    The explicit initialization of object fields to values.
    ObjectInitialization
    the initializers that perform object initialization mirror those initializers that perform class initialization.
    ObjectInitializationClassHierarchies
    If a subclass does not declare a constructor, the compiler produces a corresponding method that explicitly calls its superclass's default no-argument method.
